metadata.Title: CVE-2021-1077 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Windows and Linux, R450 and R460 driver branch, contains a vulnerability where the software uses a reference count to manage a resource that is incorrectly updated, which may lead to denial of service.

notes.Note: sbeattie> issue is in nvidia drivers, but kernels need to be respun to handle drivers mdeslaur> some binary drivers are no longer support by NVidia, so they are marked as ignored here

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-304: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-340: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-384: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
